amphibious.description: This unit does not suffer terrain penalties for fighting in water or on land.

bred for war.description: This unit cannot be diminished, and cannot have disadvantage on morale checks.

brutal.description: This unit inflicts 2 casualties on a successful power check.

courageous.description: Once per battle, this unit can choose to succeed on a morale check it just failed.

eternal.description: This unit cannot be horrified, and it always succeeds on morale checks to attack undead and fiends.

frenzy.description: If this unit diminishes an enemy unit, it immediately makes a free attack against that unit.

horrify.description: If this unit inflicts a casualty on an enemy unit, that unit must make a DC 15 morale check. Failure exhausts the unit.

martial.description: If this unit succeeds on a power check and its size is greater than the defending unit, it inflicts 2 casualties.

mindless.description: This unit cannot fail morale checks.

regenerate.description: When this unit refreshes, increment its casualty die. This trait ceases to function if the unit suffers a casualty from battle magic.

ravenous.description: While any enemy unit is diminished, this unit can spend a round feeding on the corpses to increment their casualty die.

hurl rocks.description: If this unit succeeds on an attack check, it inflicts 2 casualties. Against fortifications it inflicts 1d6 casualties.

savage.description: This unit has advantage on the first power check it makes each battle.

stalwart.description: Enemy battle magic has disadvantage on power checks against this unit.

twisting roots.description: As an action, this unit can sap the walls of a fortification. Siege units have advantage on power checks against sapped fortifications.

undead.description: Green and regular troops must pass a morale check to attack this unit. Each enemy unit need only do this once.
